intro: Thymophylla canescens, commonly known as the silver thymophylla, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
